content: Just so much BS. Who is kidding whom here? The USA is no different than any other country when it comes to techniques on obtaining intelligence information. Techniques that work will be employed. This whole thing is NOT about "waterboarding," but rather about making the former administration look bad in its decision making processess. Lets get going in the right direction and forget this crap. Bringing this stuff up is only leading to future administrations doing pretty much the same thing. Can't we all just get along?

content: Well, I see four posts one after the other demanding ignorance as the criterium for a free society. We have no right to know? What can be more harmful to America then telling us what is done in our name? I for one appreciate this memo. We HAVE been told about torture before - and statments have been made that torture was barely used. That all the information was gained in thirty seconds. That was the "Truth" before the release of this memo. So it's not that anyone is complaining about being lied to - You're complaining that you're getting the truth. My, my, my. Maybe we should pass a Constitutional Amendment? "If the truth hurts, it's a criminal offense to tell it." Dave

The absurdity of the non-logic of Obama's wondrous decision (the nation wasn't safe till he showed up, just ask the jackasses) is that the rationales touted the lack of efficacy of the techniques. But the leftist kommissars know that release of the results shows that, indeed, the results obtained from these techniques were quite effective. At least half of the information by which our nation of 300 million and the people of other lands, too, remained safe from further attacks by these islamic extremists after 9/11 derived from the techniques. And there is no moral equivalency, US vs. islamonazis. We waterboard murderous scumbags; they cut the heads off innocent people. But the current administration talking heads mouth idiotic comments about "dangers" of citizens uniting voluntarily to peacefully protest enforced collectivism, while insisting on flaccid terminology about the War on Terror that must be waged. With such absurd, control-freak, fear-of-the-people "judgment," no informed American can have confidence that the narcissists are making the right decisions. Even Leon Panetta, who the leftists of this forum praised when his appointment was tendered, thinks this release was harmful.

content: Well, I see four posts one after the other demanding ignorance as the criterium for a free society. We have no right to know? What can be more harmful to America then telling us what is done in our name? I for one appreciate this memo. We HAVE been told about torture before - and statments have been made that torture was barely used. That all the information was gained in thirty seconds. That was the "Truth" before the release of this memo. So it's not that anyone is complaining about being lied to - You're complaining that you're getting the truth. My, my, my. Maybe we should pass a Constitutional Amendment? "If the truth hurts, it's a criminal offense to tell it." Dave

content: You can know ahead of time how the obamanites play these games. Ask yourself how they'd leverage polyticks and deal with it in southside Chi-Town to gain whatever form-over-function traction it might offer. The absurdity of the non-logic of Obama's wondrous decision (the nation wasn't safe till he showed up, just ask the jackasses) is that the rationales touted the lack of efficacy of the techniques. But the leftist kommissars know that release of the results shows that, indeed, the results obtained from these techniques were quite effective. At least half of the information by which our nation of 300 million and the people of other lands, too, remained safe from further attacks by these islamic extremists after 9/11 derived from the techniques. And there is no moral equivalency, US vs. islamonazis. We waterboard murderous scumbags; they cut the heads off innocent people. But the current administration talking heads mouth idiotic comments about "dangers" of citizens uniting voluntarily to peacefully protest enforced collectivism, while insisting on flaccid terminology about the War on Terror that must be waged. With such absurd, control-freak, fear-of-the-people "judgment," no informed American can have confidence that the narcissists are making the right decisions. Even Leon Panetta, who the leftists of this forum praised when his appointment was tendered, thinks this release was harmful.

I remember an Iraqi that we captured in the Gulf War begging us not to cut off his ears. He had seen Vietnam movies that showed the practice of ear taking and was scared to death.
